channel.title: Anybody who can code can answer my question
channel.description:
How can I teach myself how to code? Is there a free guide or am I gonna have to buy something...
I'm really interested in learning I've tried over the years but never found anything that made sense.
I want to learn the ups and downs of javascript for rsps... i dont know if I could just learn what I need to know FOR an rsps or if i'm gonna have to learn entire javascript itself for rsps to make any sense. I would greatly appreciate it so much.

item.title: Anybody who can code can answer my question
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

t4:

development on linux is far easier; oh or mac because they actually have a fucking usable terminal shell.

on windows you can use Powershell (theres a way to set up new command varibles (like the ‘javac’ and ‘java’ commands, i forgot how, sorry), and its very similar to the Linux Terminal.

Read full topic

item.title: Anybody who can code can answer my question
item.dc:creator: @TiVo TiVo
item.description:
@TiVo wrote:

-Nothing:

You edit the .java files. not .class.

+1

OT:

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/getStarted/index.html

Or look up TheNewBostons’ Java Tutorials on YouTube.

Read full topic

item.source: Anybody who can code can answer my question

item.title: Anybody who can code can answer my question
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

TSK_Ben:

In the words of a noob. LOL WUT?! Do i just google Notepad ++ download o.O i heard i need a java decompiler or somethin

It’s helpful when you’re a beginner and need help with your syntax. I recommend you start out with Notepad++. You do NOT need a java decompiler. Start out by reading the official tutorials from Oracle, I found them to be very helpful.

Read full topic
item.source: Anybody who can code can answer my question

item.source: Anybody who can code can answer my question

item.title: Anybody who can code can answer my question
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

TSK_Ben:

what programs do I need to edit .class and stuff… i have JDK and SE 7 and the latest java but im confused a little bit. Do i open them as notepad or eh?

.class extensions are compiled Java code that’s generated well… when you compile. Notepad is fine, but you may want to use programs such as Notepad++ (syntax highlighter) or Netbeans (IDE). Start with basic hello world programs and such.

Read full topic
item.source: Anybody who can code can answer my question

item.source: Anybody who can code can answer my question

item.title: Anybody who can code can answer my question
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

In my opinion, Javascript would be much better for web applications, not private servers.

Learn basic Java, basic modelling, and perhaps Photoshop. Learn general computer science. You also need basic management skills if you plan to hire other developers and server helpers.

You need to be somewhat intelligent and dedicated. You need to have ideas.

Read full topic
item.source: Anybody who can code can answer my question

I want to learn the ups and downs of javascript for rsps… i dont know if I could just learn what I need to know FOR an rsps or if i’m gonna have to learn entire javascript itself for rsps to make any sense. I would greatly appreciate it so much.[/quote]
